alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings (Brooklyn); New York (Manhattan); Northern Queens; Richmond (Staten Is.); Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 3:56PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...ICY SPOTS ON UNTREATED ROADS TONIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILLS APPROACHING ZERO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... The combination of light precipitation from late last night and this morning, along with sub freezing temperatures, may result in icy spots on area roadways. Motorists should exercise caution if traveling tonight into the Friday morning commute. Meanwhile, temperatures gradually falling through the 20s this evening and into the teens overnight, along with a steady north wind 10 to 15 mph, will result in wind chills in the teens this evening, the single digits overnight, and near zero in spots toward sunrise Friday. Be sure to wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves to minimize exposure to the wind.
